intro: Albuca elliotii, commonly known as Elliot's albuca, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant produces white or pale yellow blooms that attract pollinators such as bees and moths. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade. Albuca elliotii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ease of care in arid environments.
